comments.value:
I note that the bberry and iphone formatted sites' "fullsite" link just goes back to the mobile site homepage and that, as of this morning, clicking a link on an external site from a bberry browser to a deep linked page on ours, e.g. from the BBC news report on the Olympic  schedule release, resolves to the mobile site  homepage

Can you investigate?



Alex Balfour
Head of New Media
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 117
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
www.london2012.comhttp://www.london2012.com
www.facebook.com/london2012
www.twitter.com/london2012http://www.twitter.com/london2012
wwww.youtube.com/london2012
Marking as high

Overly aggressive redirecting?

RewriteEngine On
RewriteCond %{HTTP_USER_AGENT} (nokia|symbian|iphone|blackberry|android) [NC] 
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_URI} '/(index.php|)$' [NC]
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_URI} '!/mobile' [NC]
RewriteRule (.*) /mobile/ [L]

perhaps remove the last RewriteCond?

This is fixed.
Referrals from third-party sites are now passed directly through to the correct page (rather than making the rather crude presumption that anyone with a mobile user-agent is really just looking for the mobile home-page).
Kieran

Hi Tim,

Have moved the files onto the live web server, so they should get cached via Akamai now.

This page still needs updating in the CMS but wasn't sure of the copy, do you have a CMS account / can you edit that page.
http://www.london2012.com/blog/2010/08/a-great-summer-of-world-class-paralympic-sport.php

The full urls to use (for the 2012 hosted versions) are:
http://www.london2012.com/audio/chrisholmes-interview-april-2010.mp3
http://www.london2012.com/audio/chrisholmes-interview-august-2010.mp3

http://www.london2012.com/audio/chrisholmes-interview.mp3
http://www.london2012.com/audio/chrisholmes1000daysv2.mp3

Just paste the full urls above into the Link picker in the CMS (you'll need to use the full url version with http:// etc. as these files don't exist in the CMS only only on the live servers).

Jamie

Sorry for the delayed reply, I do have an account and will update the pages today.

Thank you for your help,

Tom

As just discussed with Danny we want to use the exsiting homapage template for further splash pages (6) but we want there to be more editable options. We would also like to edit the links to. 

Webcams
Photos
Virtual tour
Video 
Possiably News and blogs. 

We will let you know about editable content and if you let us know if It makes more sense to be automated that would be great. 

http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/homepage-feature/index.php

I will get back let you know if the homepage redesign will effect the page. 


Regrads 
UZma.

Hi Uzma, 

You can already edit the Webcam, Video, Photos and Virtual tour includes, see pasted links below (from a previous email I sent to yourself and Simon on the 15 December titled 'Editable splash homepage feature' let me know if you want me to resend).

This will require editing/replacing the existing content for each of these elements/includes (which you need to open/edit separately - see attached screenshot).

In terms of selecting which ones appear (if you don't always want them all) one solution may be for us to modify this page so that automatically looks in the current folder for any photo/video/tour includes and pulls them in with appropriate option/link as required.

comments.value:
Hi
I've noticed on a couple of sports pages that if there is more than person, that on some occassions the text from the second sports star is moving to be merged with the text from the first. I have included a screenshot example from the athletics page, when you expand the text you can see that the details of carl lewis are on the bottom of the text of mo farah, and then there is no text on carl lewis's entry. 

If you look in the CMS, the text has moved in there too, despite having been entered correctly. I haven't checked all the pages to see which ones are affected but so far i have spotted it on athletics and gymnastics.

If you need anymore info then let me know.

Many thanks

Lianne
I think this can happen when the description for the first one is empty.
Actually, looking at the jpg, my previous comment was probably nonsense.
Actually ... I wonder whether it's related to the <content:group/> amendments that Janos did a little while back...

Is it possible somebody has just filled the details in incorrectly?

http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/games/olympic-sports/people/athletics.php

E.g.
  http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/games/olympic-sports/people/athletics.php
Sounds like this could have happened within the "Move the selected Group up" fix ( if i didn't imagine that ) that Dr. Janos did a while back. Its probably been like that since...
Marking this as high.

Ticket #2608 "bug on the 'who' of sport pages" was closed and merged into this ticket.

Last comment in ticket #2608: Hi Debs. This is the same as #2532. Already marked as high. Have added you to the cc list for that ticket.
